1.text: My son, attend to my wisdom, and bow your ear to my understanding:

2.text: That you may regard discretion, and that your lips may keep knowledge.

3.text: For the lips of a strange woman drop as an honeycomb, and her mouth is smoother than oil:

4.text: But her end is bitter as wormwood, sharp as a two-edged sword.

5.text: Her feet go down to death; her steps take hold on hell.

6.text: Lest you should ponder the path of life, her ways are moveable, that you can not know them.

7.text: Hear me now therefore, O you children, and depart not from the words of my mouth.

8.text: Remove your way far from her, and come not near the door of her house:

9.text: Lest you give your honor to others, and your years to the cruel:

10.text: Lest strangers be filled with your wealth; and your labors be in the house of a stranger;

11.text: And you mourn at the last, when your flesh and your body are consumed,

12.text: And say, How have I hated instruction, and my heart despised reproof;

13.text: And have not obeyed the voice of my teachers, nor inclined my ear to them that instructed me!

14.text: I was almost in all evil in the middle of the congregation and assembly.

15.text: Drink waters out of your own cistern, and running waters out of your own well.

16.text: Let your fountains be dispersed abroad, and rivers of waters in the streets.

17.text: Let them be only your own, and not strangersâ€™ with you.

18.text: Let your fountain be blessed: and rejoice with the wife of your youth.

19.text: Let her be as the loving hind and pleasant roe; let her breasts satisfy you at all times; and be you ravished always with her love.

20.text: And why will you, my son, be ravished with a strange woman, and embrace the bosom of a stranger?

21.text: For the ways of man are before the eyes of the LORD, and he ponders all his goings.

22.text: His own iniquities shall take the wicked himself, and he shall be held with the cords of his sins.

23.text: He shall die without instruction; and in the greatness of his folly he shall go astray.
